intro: Bridelia abyssinica var. rosenii, commonly known as the Abyssinian bridelia, is a shrub native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces capsules that contain small, smooth seeds. It is often found in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
